Name: Stela of Dedu-Sobek Dedy
Description: An almost square block, broken at the sides in some places. The surface is very worn. The scene, which is in the middle of the front surface in broad bands, is bordered on the left side by only a triglyphic band and closed at the bottom by a simple register line. At the top and on the right no traces of a border remain (the surface is weathered in this part). Underneath the representation is an undecorated plinth about 25 cms high. The scenes are carved in low relief and have some inner detail. Only people are depicted. The accompanying texts, each time without borders, are carved.
